name: Belladonna
description: Belladonna is a gothic adventure game, twisted and dark. Take the role of a corpse girl rising from the dead in an abandoned laboratory, and unravel the mysteries concerning your own death and reanimation.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP/Vista/7 Memory: 512 MB RAM

reviews.review_text: Belladonna is a point & click adventure game, featuring subtle horror/ Frankenstein-esque atmosphere, beautifully painted backdrops and a sweet, likable protagonist. She wakes up in a laboratory, not knowing who she is or what she is, but exhibits joy of discovery & curiosity rather than fear. Her character traits quickly emerge, like the urge to name things (suit of armor? must be Roland the Poet:) making her the more fleshed out.  The story is quite simple, but still graceful & interesting. We learn most of it by reading torn out journal pages, which are well written & well paced out. Some additional information comes from interacting with objects or looking at things. Her commentaries about the surroundings are quite enjoyable, even if they have nothing to do with the plot itself.  I liked it myself, hence the thumbs up, but it has one major flaw - length. This is very short game. If you read everything carefully and listen to the protagonist's every comment on every subject, you still will finish it under an hour. It's is also quite easy, especially if you pay attention to what is said (the main character will often hint herself as what to do next), so you basically breeze through it, which just intensifies the length problem.  Also personal & really minor gripe - card settings. I basically finished game 3 times when I hit 2 hour mark and first card dropped, and then I left it idle, but cards seem to be set do drop every half an hour or more, so I had to idle over 5 hour mark to obtain them all, in a game that takes under 1 hour to complete (and that's only if you try hard to prolong the experience).  Overall I liked the atmosphere, the story and the characters. Belladonna is an enjoyable and definitely memorable, albeit short game :)

Atmospheric little Indie point and click. And by little i mean a game that can be completed in an hour, at first time. There isn't achievements to get, but there are cards. If point and click is your preferred genre, then this is a good addition to your library. But for people who want a quality point and click, there are much better alternatives for random point and click gaming moments.  Puzzles are pretty easy, the main emphasis in this game lies in the story, and it's pretty mediocre. You can easily guess the ending halfway through the game. And at times seems like the devs were going for different endings, but for some reason didn't. There were couple pretty clear points where you, as the main character was supposed to make choices. It wuold have added replayability to this otherwise linear point and click adventure.  It's a cool, bug free game thats fun to play through once. But not really worth many euros since you get only about an hour of linear playing, best to get with a bundle. I don't even have much to say about this game :D I just don't know what to say. It's pretty neutral in my eyes.  My thumbs up is mainly to give a positive score, since it isn't a bad game, it isn't especially dull actually. This game just exists. One hour of fun, and that's about it.

Nice point and click. Too easy though. Nice story. Though predictable.  Has cards, but I finished game in 1 hour and had only 3 out of 7 at that point (yeah - another game that you will iddle).   Recommend to buy only if discounted.

While simple and short, the voice acting was good, the artwork was pleasing to the eye, and the story was interesting enough to propel me forward. Others say it could have been more. I guess so, but what there is was still enjoyable. If you like macabre little stories and aren't overly concerned about the complexity of puzzles in your adventure games, it's worth a playthrough.

Pros and Cons list at the bottom of the review.   Belladonna is a decent point-and-click adventure, and it's low price tag makes it easier to recommend.   The story is not exactly inspired, somewhat of a generic 'Frankenstein's Monster' story, but it is passable. About halfway through the game you will likely have guessed the rest of the plot.   The game itself is only about 75-90 minutes long, depending on how fast you read and how much backtracking you have to do to grab items you didn't see the first time. Luckily, the game levels are not very large, so backtracking isn't much of a pain. The puzzles themselves are not too bad, I had an easier time with this game than some other point-and-click's where what you have to do next is very obscure.   The writing and voice acting are somewhat amateurish, though for the most part the journals you will read throughout the game were not too badly written. The main character's voice just sounded off to me, more like a young boy than a young woman's.   The graphics and aesthetics in the game are likely the best part of the game, and I thought everything was beautifully done. The only issue graphics-wise would be the walking animation. I didn't notice it too much until I was almost finished with the game, but the characters legs look strange when she walks, it does not work smoothly.   The biggest issue with the game would have to be the ending. I knew that I was nearing the end, but instead of finishing the storyline, it basically was one last click and then I was brought to a big 'game over' screen. The game was mostly wrapped up, but it needed a few more lines of dialogue and/or another cutscene to properly bring the game to an end. It was rather jarring.   Overall, for the asking price, especially if you can get it on sale, I would recommend this game if you are a point-and-click adventure fan.   Pros: +Graphics/Artstyle +Decent writing, if not as refined as one may like +Clear, non-frustrating puzzles +Low asking price  Neutral: +/- Short game length (can be a pro or con depending on the person's interest in the game)  Cons: -Not great voice acting  -Abrupt and unsatisfying ending

Can I reccomend this game? Hmm I guess i can. But get it on sale, I don't think you will be happy buying it on a full price. And that's why.  The game is very short, I've done it in less than 1.5 hours reading all the letters and staring on every scene to enjoy it's beauty. The drawings are great in this game and strangely it seems like different scenes are drawn by different artists, at least 2-3 of them. Dut despite all these beauty it's only like 10 or so scenes in this game which is not much. As for the gameplay it's more like a story-driven waling simulator in a form of an adventure game. Yes it has more than just walking around but believe me it's barely 15-20 usable items in the game so it doesn't make any difference. Also the use of items is very logical which is a plus of course but the minus is you use it immediately very often, few pixels away from the place you found them.  Overall the story is interesting though not very original, game is well-made, art-style is great, diary pages are entertaining ro read but the game is very easy, short and lacks actual gameplay and also the game almost has no ending and looks like devs wanted to make more but decided to just cut the game to the The End screen at some point.

This game is cute, in a dark and twisted kind of way. I'd give it 5/10, and I recommend it only because it's 0,69€ now, and for that price it's a total catch. PROS: + I loved the artwork and the general environment. + Music wasn't annoying, and voice acting was ok. + I liked the Steampunk vibe, the theme, and the story was cool. + References to Mary Shelley and Edgar Allan Poe, which made me squeal in delight. + Easy and logical, there is no constant backtracking, no pixel hunt, and no nonsensical inventory combinations.  CONS: - Extremely short. I'm a VERY slow player, and I finished it in 2 hours, and that is including a pause I took for dinner while leaving the game on. - Too easy. Not one puzzle and not one remotely challenging situation. - The ending leaves lose ends, almost as if hoping for a sequel.  In short, if on sale, go for it. It's a nice hour and bit of a dark little story. But if you're into really challenging stuff, this one may bore you a bit. I still enjoy it and I'm not sorry I got it (then again, I got it for 0,69€).

This is a short but very well done game. I enjoyed how straight-forward the puzzles were, and I loved the aesthetics of the game, too. The main character is creepy cute, and I was very pleased to see the game did not end the way I thought it would. If you want to have a little fun and support a small developer making a game with themes most large publishers wouldn't touch with a magnet on a pole, buy Belladonna.

TL:DR - A very short adventure game with nice atmosphere and a decent story. Probably only worth it if its on sale though, due to the game's length.  Full review -         YouTube™ Video:  Belladonna Review (PC)
This game is beautiful and is so interesting to play. I loved it very much.

Well, I've just finished this rather short but intriguing adventure game and wrote my first walkthrough. :) It's not the most difficult point and click adenture but I found it enjoyable enough to play to the end. Some of the scenes are nicely drawn and the voice acting is functional enough. If you enjoy this type of game I'd certainly encourage you to buy it although don't expect too much from it. Also, devs, get some achievments incorporated into the game! Recommended!

This being my first game review, I would like to add that if i didnt find this game to be wonderful I wouldn't bother. I'm not hugely into point and click games, however this game appealed to me at first look. The shortness of it leaves much to the imaginings of the players, and I can't help but feel ultimately inspired by this short story. Beautiful.

It's very short (60-70 min.) and very easy which might lead me to recommend it for kids, except that some of the subject matter is not suitable for kids. I'm not sure what the intended target audience is supposed to be. Still, I enjoyed it. The story as well as the visual style kept me interested for the hour or so it took to play through the game.

Belladonna was a very enjoyable game for me :) Game time says 1.8 hours but realistically (once you minus all the ilding time) it could be played in about an hour to 90 minutes. I was gifted this game during the winter sale - $7 is a bit steep for an extremely short game in my honest opinion so get it during sale time or when/if the game is improved with more content.  + a quick and easy game (point and click) - therefore its relaxing in a way + story was interesting and easy to follow + art is beautiful, especially for the small objects (though Klara's walking animation was a bit awkward) + music was pleasant and relevant  - I wish the writing on the letters were in bold/larger or an option to make the font verdana or tahoma to make it easier for blind ♥♥♥ gamers like me - super short game for $7  Adding in voices is always a huge plus when it comes to games as it adds to the experience while playing. But, I had to mute my laptop for a bit   when Belladonna started talking. Not that it was a horrible voice, it just felt very misplaced and awkward. Klara on the other hand was adorable. Maybe it was the stark contrast in the accents?   Despite that, from what I can see from the credits I am assuming the voices are all one person(?) so kudos to her!  A DLC or multiple endings would be a plus!
Very beautiful, gothic romantic. I recommend this to everyone!

This game is a short point-and-click adventuring type of game. There are no 'real' puzzles to solve, but there's exploration and commentary from the protagonist. The nods to literary greats like Mary Shelley and Edgar Allan Poe were lovely, especially for bookworms like me! (There's also a character who is extremely reminiscent of the Bride of Frankenstein.)  The history and character information are fleshed out via journal pages/letters that you find while exploring. Each story is intriguing, with maybe one or two unexpected, little twists. While the style of the fonts were pretty, they were sometimes hard to read, but even I -- with glasses several years old -- read them just fine.  The music went well with the art style, and I appreciated some of the more dramatic moments. The voice acting was pretty good, not over-the-top or cheesy at all. Mechanics were easy and intuitive.  Overall, this is a great game for someone interested in a more casual point-and-click experience with a good amount of storyline. A bit short, but more than worth it for a sale price.

Really fun little game! I found the plot interesting to follow. I had missed one detail and that led me to wander around confused, but I'd watched a walkthrough video on the steam community page that let me know what I missed. This is a game you wouldn't want to rush, as I really enjoyed the MC's thought process when you explore a lot. Not a whole lot of gameplay, but it was interactive enough (and the puzzles were more clever than straining) to keep my attention. Definitely get this game if it's on sale!

I only hate there's no acheivements but trading kind of make up for it I guess it's to bad i could not play this during last halloween.
Story driven lesbian frankenstein point & click adventure game. Predictable story but still pretty cool 6.7/10.

Wow this is weird, but in a good way! Really nice (if that's the word, given the subject matter) little game. Very inventive and I love the heavy stylisation. Quite brief, but worth it for how different it is to many others.

Tl:DR; Very short, Fankenstain inspired Point and Click game with curious story. I wish it was twice the length. Game crashed 3 times during a gameplay, but was worth every cent anyway. Mind you - I bought it on sale with -90%.  Review: Belladona is short point'n'click game with a decent story and very cute graphics.  Music is so-so,  This is of free flash game quality, but I don't feel cheated out of my money - I liked the story and the setting and the graphics.  All I wish there was more puzzles and more to do in general :)  I recommend this game on sale only - charging 6.99 for 1h title is a bit extreme to me.

Belladonna  it's an indie Point & Click game. That reminds those old legends of the mad scientists and their abominations  (such as Frankenstein, The doctor Jekyll and Mr. Hyde, among others) , themed with a gothic / horror atmosphere, belladonna would have been an indie game that you should own, i mean there are many facts that makes this game interesting:    Great atmosphere.    Visually friendly.    Amazing background art.    Nice background music.    In-game story is so good, until certain point.   The story begins when you awake from an eternal dream  (you are a re-animated corpse from which once was a girl) , in a scientist laboratory. Without memories of your past or thoughts that what happened, during the walkthrough you will find notes that tell the true story about the place in where are you and you.   These points makes it just another failed attempt of a great game.

The game is more of short demo than full-fledged adventure.   It is super short - around 30 min. Most of story is told via scattered letters, so you just read 10 pages of text and complete 1 dialog and game ends. Story itself is predictable and quite subpar.  Puzzles are super easy. You can't skip walking animation by double clicking on scene exit, quite a major flaw in games with exploration and backtracking.  I think amount of content in this game is even not enough to compete with web-based escape from the room adventures.  Not worth of buying unless you after steam trading cards.

Sadly, I was disappointed with this game. It starts out very slowly, and right when it gets really interesting, it's suddenly over. As others already said, there is very little room to figure things out by yourself as the main character basically tells you the next step you should take while she is narrating. I also had problems with the cat part. Not even a trigger warning about it?? :( I almost wanted to stop playing because I got so upset. What happened was important to the storyline, BUT since the game has such a rushed ending, it felt pointless. The graphics are really nice, though, and I liked the story we read in the diary pages. I just wish that the letters were bigger, since it was really very hard to read! And to talk about the music: The track is nice, but gets really boring/annoying since it is the only thing you'll ever hear in the game. On loop. I do not recommend this game to anyone. Sorry. :(
You have to kill a cat 0/10

Ok, let me put it plainly. This isnt looking like a complete game. The whole game can be played under less than a couple hours with no speeding WHATSOEVER. It really is made with little content at all!  I would have wanted to start with the pro's, rather than con's, but...there are very little pro's to it:  - the concept: it is sort of interesting, sadly it remained what it was, a concept; - SOME, and i mean SOME of the visuals are truly keeping up with the graphic style entirely; - voice acting: Klara is rather nicely acted, a nice voice to listen to actually;  CON'S  - game content and inherently its length: are you kidding me??? The game is made out of maybe not even 10 rooms! And some of them are only used as passage from an area to the other, while other contains just a note and nothing else! - story: the plot is almost entirely unfold through handwritten notes over and over AND over again. If that wasnt enough, they're just an image and therefore the font can't even scale up to proportion, and stays awfully small.  - puzzles: all of the puzzles are just a joke. They take seriously no time at all to figure out, and often you're even told plainly what to do. They're not even puzzles!  - some drawings: i chuckled as i saw Doctor's Wolf body. It has so many issues...and Belladonna isnt truly well drawn either. - animations: oh my freaking god. Klara literally fluctuates and has no interaction whatsoever with the surroundings. - overall lack of polish and care: room transitions carrying the description 'exit' or 'to the next room', truly short soundtrack looping over and over, lack of basic interaction. - the ABRUPT ending. There's not even a cinematic at the end. Just a colorful screen with an 'END' sign so you get it, at least....  In conclusion: this game was either not completely taken care of or maybe it was completed in a rush. As the story stands, it's pretty much uncompleted and feels more of a demo rather than a complete game.

It's more like visual novel than adventure game. Pretty straight - only one room with 'crossroad', where you. It's a pity becase it has good graphic, animation, character design, voiceover. But the game and story part are very dissapointing.

Dissapointing.  I managed to complete this game in a little more than 30 minutes, and both the story and gameplay fell almost completely flat.  Puzzles were way too easy, and the story was not written well enough for me to relate to any of the characters, whose voice acting was, by the way, really subpar. (MINOR SPOILER) I honestly ended up feeling more sorry for the doctor, than the wife, which only made the ending much more unsatisfying(SPOILER END)  Maybe buy it, if you can get it for real cheap in a bundle, and you like puzzle games and/or interesting artstyles. Otherwise, save your money.
